Reviews.Title: “Basic, good location but totally "blah"!”
Reviews.Author: Rob M
Reviews.Content: Ok, where to start? We checked in and the service was great, if slow, because almost everything is still written down and not computerised. We were given a "Garden Room" (room 334), also known as a ground floor room with a 2sq.m. pavement with a table and chair (not exactly Gardenesque). We put our bags down, put money and passports in the safe and went for a walk. It's a 10min walk to Circo Massimo and the Metro, and another 10mins to the Colosseum, so the location is good but the roads and pavements around the hotels are badly cracked and in need of repair, so walking with bags was troublesome. When we came back, our room had ants all over the floor, the shower leaked BADLY and the bath wasn't sealed at all, and worst of all the safe wouldn't open as several of the buttons wouldn't register. We eventually changed rooms, got everything out of the safe and got an in-hotel room next to the dining room (room 331). We were greeted to a damp smell as the room hadn't been aired due to the bathroom having no exterior window. The bed was comfortable but the shower wasn't confined by a curtain/glass and the floor wasn't angled to allow the water to drain, so the water went everywhere and we had to use towels to mop the excess in order to use the toilet and sink safely. The staff at night as they were setting up the dining room for breakfast were very loud. The breakfast sucked! There was no type of juice (only a sickly sweet "fruit juice"), only two types of cereal that were very bland, the croissants/pastries were soooooo dry that I had to take a sip of coffee (the quality of which differed day in, day out) with every bite to make my mouth remoisten, the bread was very dry (no choice of type; only white) with only ONE 2 slice toaster available, but there was a good selection of fruit and yogurts. Lastly, the airport transfer service that the hotel ordered for us on the return started to take us to the wrong airport despite my confirmation several times with the receptionist that we were going to Ciampino. The driver confirmed on the booking sheet, signed by the hotel, that the hotel had stated the wrong airport. Lovely. Basically, for about 110€ a night + "Rome Tourist Tax", I expected a lot more. Would I stay there again? No. The hotels nearer the city centre were slightly more expensive but after speaking to other travellers that we met about their better experiences, we would consider spending more for more comfort and better value if we visited Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: Bob W
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed on the Aventine Hill, and I will never stay anywhere else. You can easily walk to the Forum/Colosseum, Baths of Caracalla, Via Appia, and a longer walk to the centro storico. Metro is a pleasant walk - 10-15 minutes on leafy residential streets. At night it is quiet and you can sleep with your windows open. In the evening, just walk down the hill from your quiet hilltop oasis to Testaccio for non-touristy restaurants and trendy night-spots. The hotel is one of three under common ownership within a couple of blocks of each other - all are villas made into hotels. Very atmospheric...cocoons in the middle of the city. Service was very helpful...they received my luggage which the airline delivered 6 days late, they called the airline's airline's lost-luggage department to help me retrieve my luggage, and they helped with arranging for an early morning taxi. 5 Stars for service! The only caveat is that there are two garden rooms that are very musty. Be sure you get a room in the main house. I wish I could return this moment!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was great and the service even better”
Reviews.Author: kkb07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this lovely out-of-the-way hotel on a recent weekend trip to Rome to celebrate 20 years since we fist met in Rome! We had not done much preplanning and were sort of shooting from the hip so we were especially delighted that Justin, the concierge, was so incredibly helpful. We had a tip on a very popular restaurant by the name of Cul de Sac but no reservation . . . and of course we were interested in Saturday night! Justin was first told that there would be no way to reserve but he did not take no for an answer and after much discussion we were given an 8:00 reservation. It was packed with locals and was a highlight of our trip, so thank you Justin! The entire staff was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a nice quiet location”
Reviews.Author: asmith123
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and went when it was very hot out. The air conditioning here was great, as were the surrounding gardens. The room was clean and so was the bathroom, both were very nice. We loved the breakfast and also loved the breakfast area. Neighborhood was very nice and quiet for sleeping. Only negative is it is a far walk to the action, 15-20 mins but we did not mind. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: Kevin G
Reviews.Content: I spent two weeks in the Aventino hotel in Rome, Italy. This hotel is one of three (the Aventino, the San Anselmo, and the San Pio) in a quiet residential area on a hill that overlooks the Circus Maximus. I was working at the FAO building, and it is a easy to do 20 minute walk from the Aventino to FAO through quiet residential streets and then past shops and restaurants. Most of downtown Rome is within range of a walking tour with the Circus, the Forum, and the Coliseum within easy reach - and sites such as the Spanish Steps and the Pantheon and shopping on the Via del Corso certainly do-able if you want to stretch your legs. No health club, and only the Pio has an attached restaurant - but elegant surroundings, spotless rooms, good beds, and plenty of hot water in the showers. And the shining star is the staff, who within a day will remember what kind of coffee you want at the complimentary cold breakfast offered in each of the hotels and who will know you by name not long after that. The concierge will gladly recommend a restaurant, talk about things to see, or negotiate a better price for your taxi to the airport. The rooms are small , taken up with the(very comfortable) king sized bed and a small desk - but there is cable tv and wireless offered without extra charge in the rooms and a modern bathroom. You need to go out to eat or to see Rome - but you are a 10 minute walk from shops and restaurants. This is a great way to see Rome, and it is really nice to come back to someplace as welcoming as this. Good for singles or couples - it could be a very romantic get-away, but not really set up for a family with children

Reviews.Title: “The Beautiful Aventino”
Reviews.Author: baggagecarrier
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Aventino is one of the three under the same ownership set in the midst of the beautiful Aventino Hill. We have stayed at all three (the Hotel San Anselmo and the Hotel Villa San Pio being the others). We had a corner room with a wrap-around balcony - just heavenly in the morning sun smelling the jasmine flowers and listening to church bells. Our room was furnished baroque style with silver-leaf framed mirrors and bedside tables and a coffered ceiling with silver rosettes - nice! The internet is free and the breakfasts in a room decorated with enormous paintings framed in stone were more than satisfactory. If it had been warmer we would have eaten in the garden where the camillias were already in bud, and the the maidenhair fern was flourishing along with other flowers that did not recognize that it was fall. The neighborhood is very quiet with the umbrella pine needles softening the sound of our footsteps on the cobblestones. There is now a restaurant in the Villa San Pio for those who do not want to walk the three or four blocks to the many nearby restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: atravellingiwillgo
Reviews.Content: Just stayed two nights here, and will be back. The hotel is in a really lovely setting, very quite neighborhood, very green and calm. The rooms are nice, not overly large or luxurious but are more than adequate with a desk, wardrobe, table, and in my case a small balcony with table and chairs. There is no restaurant, but there are a few choices nearby, and the sister hotel is a short walk away with a nice restaurant if you want to stay in for dinner. Trastevere is a short nice walk away, with the opportunity to stop and see Santa Sabina church and the spectacular views over Rome - if you go at sunset it is really beautiful and you get to see the swarms of starlings in the fall - really a sight not to be missed. Likewise, heading the other way you are a short walk from Circus Maximus, Palantine Hill etc etc., the metro is here as well. Staff were to a person lovely. I needed to stay in for dinner one night and do some work and so brought take away in from the grocery store. The gentleman at the desk took me to the kitchen used for breakfast and heated up my meal, got me set up with plate, utensils etc and brought me a wine glass to the room, all with good humor and helpfulness. Others staffing the desk were equally helpful as was the woman managing the breakfast room each morning. Free wireless in the rooms and lobby. Not a very strong signal. Also a free computer terminal in the lobby if you don't have a laptop with you. Breakfast included, very typical to what you will find in European hotels, good coffee, yogurt, fresh fruit choices, cereal, bread, pastry, cheeses, meats, juices. All you could want...... It is a bit off the beaten path and is an uphill walk home (not too bad though) or a quick taxi ride. If you want a peaceful setting combined with ease of access to the city this is a good choice. I know I will be back as have found my Rome hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael W
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel in a perfect and quiet location. I felt like I was staying in a little palazzo...it was a very special stay and the breakfast and staff were great...would definitely reccommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Too far, too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Syrah-Viognier
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aventino is located in the Aventino neighborhood of Rome, which is a very quiet residential area with large houses and villas. However, it is too far away to walk to or from any of the main touristic attractions of Rome. We timed it and it takes 16' on foot to get from the Circo Massimo metro station. There are some bus lines that stop a few blocks away from the hotel but they aren't very frequent and you have to wait 10' to 15' at the bus stop. To get to Trastevere you need at least 30' on foot. The rooms look luxurious on photos but at closer inspection you realise that most of the furniture is rather cheap. The hook for the shower in the bathroom was loose and the taps in the sink and the bathtab got stuck all the time. Minor details that are unacceptable for the rates this hotel is charging you. Not to mention that the curtains hadn't been washed for a long time. The buffet breakfast is only decent: you can have croissants, boiled eggs, marmelades, cereal, milk, juice, cake and of course coffee. Although there is someone at the lobby/reception desk, not all of them speak English fluently. In conclusion it's a rather expensive hotel, that it should offer more for the price you pay, too far away from where the action takes place in Rome. We'd recommend it only to business travelers who want to relax after a busy day and can afford the taxi to get to the hotel every day.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet retreat.....”
Reviews.Author: Cava123
Reviews.Content: Great neighborhood. Small rooms but nice and the convenient without being in the crazy tourist places.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in a very quiet area, walking distance (~15min) to main tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: SKLA
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Aventino with my teenage daughter for two nights. It is a charming hotel in an old villa in the Aventine Hill. If you want peace and quiet, yet be close to the main tourist attractions (~10-15 minute walk to the Colloseum, Platine Hill and the Forum; 5 minutes to a beautiful little park with a view of the St. Peters and the Tevere) this is the place for you. The room was small, but very clean and well equipped with free internet, an in-room safe, air condition, and a nice bathroom. Very peaceful at night - we slept comfortably with our window open. The hotel staff are knowledgeable, friendly, patient, and helpful. The hotel was not cheap, but relative to the outrageous prices in Rome is, it was not unreasonable. If you are willing to risk a last minute booking, I would phone them directly and try to negotiate a last minute deal.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Joannaspencer
Reviews.Content: We found this a delightful hotel to come back to after a day sightseeing and invariable took a walk into the Testaccio area for dinner each evening rather than returning to the center by taxi. The Metro stops at 9pm. Our standard room was well furnished but small and as one of the windows wouldn’t close properly the air conditioning didn’t work. We met many different reception staff during our three day stay but there was only one on duty at a time and their level of service varied enormously. Some had a poor command of English and struggled to understand or answer the simplest of questions. Most guests were Italian and on business.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for your Rome experience”
Reviews.Author: NilsM64
Reviews.Content: This is officially a *** hotel, but is better than many ****. Situated on the tranquil Aventine hill you are guaranteed a quiet night. Traffic here is virtually zero, and sleeping with the window open is no problem. Breakfast is not over-done, but moderate, good coffee, freshly baked white bread rolls, fruit, yoghurt, etc. From here you are perfectly located to access all the attractions of The Eternal City; Trastevere, Circus Maximus, Forum and Colosseum are within walking distance. The nearby metro station quicly takes you further. Staff is attentive and friendly. Please note that BBC and CNN are on position 900 and above on the TV remote.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a peaceful area”
Reviews.Author: Oodley
Reviews.Content: We spent our wedding anniversary week in this lovely peaceful hotel. All the staff were friendly, nothing was too much trouble for them. The room was nicely furnished, with a good bathroom. We love visiting cities but always try to stay some way out from the hustle of the tourists and choosing Easter week to visit Rome meant that this hotel was in the perfect location. Yes, it's on a hill, but there are 7 hills in Rome, and the Aventine was a really good choice to stay it did mean a climb, but the surroundings made it very doable indeed. If you are looking for somewhere to eat suggest you take the shortcut through the park and go over to the Trastevere area where the restaurants are cheaper with friendlier service.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: runderbar
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with Aventino. The location is perfect: quiet, green, short walk to metro Circus Massimo, bus/tram stop (bus 3 from vialle Aventino takes you directly to the Coloseum 3 stops). Going in the other direction, look for Clivo di Rocca Savella, a cool quiet pedestrian alley that will lead you down from Santa Sabina to the river to cross the bridge into the Trastevere neighborhood (good place to get dinner, coffee, drinks). Free wired internet in room, very clean, tile floors, room 348 had a wrap around balcony with two double doors, you could suntan all day if you liked, the room wasn't overly large and the beds were a bit hard, but the room was fantastic with splendid views of old mansions and trees all around. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was only mediocre and could have been reinforced with an espresso bar. Better to plan to have a nice brunch in town. I didn't go inside any of the other San Selmo hotels in the area, (there are 3 in the neighborhood) but they seem to be even finer so any one of them would do. I have been to Rome several times and I can say that now I would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem in a quiet residential area”
Reviews.Author: Anoymous77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is charming. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our bedroom was beautifully decorated and very comfortable. Although our room had air conditioning, we preferred to sleep with the window open, which was possible as the location is so quiet. Being so close to the best view of Rome is also a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not worth the $”
Reviews.Author: LukeGroskin
Reviews.Content: Overall review 5 out of 10. Why: 1. Our King sized bed was two twins put together! 2. Extremely slow internet + no in room wi-fi access for those without laptops 3. The secluded area is a little annoying to get to for public transport. 4. Our room had a steady buzz coming from the bathroom...all rooms have this. It's the towel heater and it's pretty annoying. 4. There is 1 person acting as Consierge, front desk, at anytime and he is ALWAYS too busy until 10 PM/. 5. Sometimes this 1 consierge treated guests extremely poorly. For example, one laughed in my face when I asked where I could get a bus map in Rome "Bus map? Rome doesn't have this thing you call Bus Map" .... Word for word that's that's what he said. (After waiting 10 minutes for the internet to load, I did actually find one.) I watched this same consierge refuse to stand up and help a new guest get their luggage through the front door...less than 10 feet away, despite the poor guy clearly was having difficulty

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - If you want to walk a lot”
Reviews.Author: South_Park_Aardvark
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 5 nights as part of vacation to Italy. It's in a great neighborhood (upscale and very quiet) but at the same time, restaurants in the area are a bit sparse...actually we didn't see any in the immediate area, and we covered a lot territory on foot That was no problem for us as we enjoyed walking into the main historic part of Rome each day and walked back through Trastevere, which has a lot of restaurant choices. But still, that's a 20-30 minute walk back to the hotel. Sights like the Colosseum and Forum are walkable. Take the Metro (Circus Maximum station is nearby) to reach sites in the north end, like St. Peter's. There were some embassies in the area and I suspect some of the guests there were on business, rather than pleasure. No complaints about the hotel...it was great. Maybe the location may be a bit too far afield for some tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for sightseeing trip”
Reviews.Author: TAW4
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel located in a quite part of the city. Very close to the historical center. Good value for money. Our room was very basic, no frills and thats exactly what we needed. Room was spacious. Breakfast was the same everyday, but selection was good. Very friendly staff and very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but barter for the best price”
Reviews.Author: jaimeelsabio
Reviews.Content: A nice, small, hotel located relatively close to many of the major sites (10-15 minute walk). The room was nice as was the bathroom. The staff was cordial and friendly; the breakfast typical European. It did provide free Wifi. The hotel sits on a hill, so for people with walking difficulties, a hotel closer in might be better. It is close to a number of bus stops. The hotel was gated so only guests could get in. My only complaint was the price. We had initially booked for one set of dates, but had to reschedule for two weeks later due to a volcanic eruption in Iceland. When we rescheduled, the price was fully 1/3 higher. While there, I overheard a number of people state their rates, and they were significantly lower than what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel if you don't mind the walk”
Reviews.Author: AlainaMRZ
Reviews.Content: I have been to Rome several times, and have stayed in several areas of town, but hands down, Aventine hill is the best part of town to stay. The only downfall is, it is about a ten minute walk from the Metro stop Circo Massimo. It is a nice walk though, in a residential neighborhood. When you stay on Aventine hill, you feel like you escape the craziness of Rome. Aventine hotel is very nice. Clean, comfortable, good breakfast, good hot showers. The rooms are pretty small, but they are in excellent condition and have all the amenities. When we checked in the first night, the staff was extremely irritating. We walked through the door and he started to check us in, but then the phone rang so he answered that for 5 minutes. Then another guest walked in and asked for a taxi, so the clerk stopped what he was doing again, and ordered a taxi. We had had a long flight, it was late, so I'm sure that made things worse, but the night staff seemed very frazzled. The day staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very nice room”
Reviews.Author: javeryt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on our way out of Italy after spending most of our time in the Tuscany region. Loved the hotel. In a very quiet and quaint neighborhood at the top of the hill. Can almost be deceiving how quiet it is, since you are right next to some of the major tourist spots (Circus Maximus is literary a 10 minute walk away). The staff was very, very helpful and courteous, and arranged for a cab to the airport the next morning quite late the night before (flat rate of 40 euro, not bad considering the train is 14 euro a ticket). Breakfast is good and available till 10:30. Room was really uniquely decorated and very, very good AC. Felt great to lie in the big bed with the AC on after a day seeing the sights. Great shower too, loads of hot water and pressure. My only negative would be it was rather difficult to find the first time. The map they gave us after arrival did help us find it after that, but they should just scan that map and post it on their website....it would take 5 minutes and help out a lot of weary/hot travelers such as ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Look no further - this place has it all”
Reviews.Author: TrailBlazer_7
Reviews.Content: We picked the Aventino because of the favorable reviews on TripAdvisor and other travel websites. It's located on a quiet residential street in a safe neighborhood, about a 20 minute walk to the Coliseum and 10 minutes to the Circo Massimo subway station. It is also less than a mile from my aunt's house, which was an additional bonus for us. The room we had (# 344) was a standard double with a king-size bed. The room is small, barely larger than the bed, but completely adequate for our needs. The A/C was ice cold, which was important for us since we live in Oregon and sweat buckets when the temp is above 80 degrees with 50%+ humidity, which it was when we were there. The room and bathroom were spotless when we arrived, and the housekeeping service kept it that way for the week we were there. Breakfast is standard continental, which was perfectly adequate. The hotel has a resident calico cat named "Aventina" who wanders in and out of the hotel, including the dining room. Since we love cats, we thought that this was pretty cool. If you're looking for a reasonably priced, clean hotel that's close to the subway and to the Coliseum, you can't beat the Aventino. We paid 80 euro per night through the hotel's website, and we got more than we expected. We will definitely stay here next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Peter_and_Barbara
Reviews.Content: I cannot think of any better location for a holiday in Rome than on the Aventine Hill - as long as you enjoy walking. It is within an easy walk down to the 'centro storico' - historic centre. There are also easy walks down to underground stations, buses and the mainline station at Ostiense. And for very good eating without the risk of landing up in a tourist trap there are wonderful restaurants to be found in Testaccio - again an easy walk away. The thing you always have to remember is it is also a walk back UP to return to the hotel. However unlike any other comparable location in Rome it is wonderfully quiet and peaceful. There are also superb views of Rome to be had from the Orange Garden. The Aventino is a lovely hotel with really good and friendly service. We stayed for 10 days and found the people at the hotel always very helpful. Breakfast was nice. The room suited our needs. Because we were staying a comparatively long time we were very careful in our choice of rooms because we wanted a large wardrobe. We also noted in other reviews that some of the rooms were on the small size. We were advised in our email conversations prior to booking to go for room 338 and that certainly met our needs. It also had a small balcony which we greatly appreciated. We will certainly go back to the Aventino Hotel when we next return to Rome. We had actually booked to stay in the Tower Room for one final day before flying home, following a week out of Rome, but this was in Rome's low season in mid August, and we were offered an upgrade to a lovely room with a terrace at the Hotel San Pio. That too was a lovely experience. We are still keen to spend at least one night in the Tower Room. Certainly the views from the communal terrace at the San Pio were wonderful - looking out over southern Rome and into the Alban Hills. And so if the views from the Tower Room are similar, that would certainly be worth paying the extra for. Peter and Barbara

Reviews.Title: “the best stay ever”
Reviews.Author: caityistoohot
Reviews.Content: we arraived at aventino with hopes of a fun and exciting stay. we recieved just that. the staff was very accomidating and the hospitality was of the best. i would reccomend this hotel to anyone who enjoys a tranquil enviroment and appreciates terrific views that are close by. a 5 minute walk to the bus as well as the metro. you are able to sleep in until 10 am and still recieve a breakfast that will be unforgetable. i highly reccomend this hotel to anyone who wants to have a relaxing time during their stay in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil, attentive; a haven”
Reviews.Author: genben9
Reviews.Content: I spent a summer living in a convent (cheap and safe) on the aventine hill and it is considered by locals one of the best locations in Rome. It is lush and quiet, green and peaceful, spotted with monestaries and convents and a rose garden and nestled next to circus maximus. The Aventino is a great hotel in a lovely location. It is small but well staffed and feels more like a wonderfully sumptous home versus a hotel. I will definitley be coming back

Reviews.Title: “Tranquillity in a great location”
Reviews.Author: molonglo
Reviews.Content: The Aventino is a great central location, between the Forum and Trastevere, quiet and leafy. The hotel has all the needed amenities and is great value. The staff were decent enough to let me park inside - although street parking is also available.

Reviews.Title: “A Great hotel - Everything we expected and more, One of the best kept secrets in Rome”
Reviews.Author: nichemarket10
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome, and we were very much looking forward to our 5 night stay in this hotel....we were not disappointed!!! (The pictures on the internet do not do it justice - imo). The hotel Aventino is set in a residential area about 10 minutes bus ride from the Colosseum and about 15-20 minutes from the city centre. It is not located right in the city centre but is in a good location on the outskirts, which allow you to escape the hussle and bussle of the city while still letting you enjoy the romanesque feel of the citys surroundings. We booked two rooms one for double use, and one for single. We at the time of booking requested that they be near each other and that they be up on one of the higher floors, both requests were satisfied without problem on our arrival. It was perfect for what we wanted as it was quiet during both day and night - and we were able to open the windows (in fact one of the rooms came with a small balcony with double doors leading out to it, which was great due to the summer heat) there was also an air conditioning system in both rooms but found ourselves not needing them! Each room came with lovely big beds, tv and good sized bathroom! The breakfast each morning was continental, it was nice and fresh served by the friendly staff! There are transport links near the hotel such as the bus (no.75), which goes to and from the termini and there is also a metro located at the bottom of the hill around the main street area (about a 5-7minute walk away from the hotel) which link to the main attractions and other city centre places. We found that the bus was the best way to get around as it helped take in the sights while on route. If you are planing to use taxis as a method of transport for any reason, I would encourage anyone who stays here to keep the hotels name and address on a piece of paper and to take it with you while out, as the hotel is quite a well kept secret even amongst local cab drivers who didn't even know it existed - and kept getting it mixed up with the sister hotels "san pio" and "anselmo" (which are only around the corner btw)! Our stay in this hotel was very enjoyable due to its beautiful setting, quietness, cleanliness and helpful staff. If re-visiting Rome we will definitely be returning to this hotel and will be giving it a high recommendation to anyone thinking of staying!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was living in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Fekla
Reviews.Content: What an adorable place! First, the staff was awesome. I only speak a little Italian, and we were in Rome during major holidays, so the front desk guys would call the museums for us to see when/if they were open. Second, the breakfast room was incredibly cute. You could hear the children from the nearby houses, and the whole atmosphere is like... ok, you're in Italy - not visiting, though, but living there. Third, sitting out on the balcony after a crazy day of site-seeing in Rome well after midnight, I felt like I was at home in my own patio. We didn't find any good restaurants nearby, but the place on Viale Aventino (at the bottom of the hill) sells the best prosciutto and olives. We stocked up on those, bread, wine, and cheese, got fresh tomatoes and grapes (and flowers too!) from the market a couple of blocks away from that shop, and now some of my best memories of Italy are actually from that balcony, in the middle of a hot night full of lilac, Chianti, and real Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in quiet area of Rome”
Reviews.Author: TONYfromTO
Reviews.Content: As epected, this hotel was in a quieter residential area of Rome, the Aventine Hills just 15-20 minutes walk from the Colloseum. It was good value and the staff were always friendly and helpful. It is close to the Metro which is very easy to use and just 1 Euro for almost anywhere in the city. There is a dirth of restraunts but we managed to find a couple of nice one just down over the hill. Breakfast is great and included with the room charge. There was no air conditioning this time of year so we slept with the windows open which was OK except for the occasional motor cycle or truck. But, we always bring ear plugs so no big deal. The rooms are spacious, the bathroom has a full size shower with plenty of hot water. The beds are OK (better than most European hotels) and the hotel is certainly clean and well run. Skip the meal at their sister hotel, food was mediocre and way overpriced, service even worse. Instead, travel down to the Trastevere region across the Tiber as there are many many great restaurants in that area. Warning - a great many do not open until 8PM or even 8:30PM. It is a bit out of the way and this may perturb some as there is some extra walking. Making good use of the Metro minimises this problem and there is certainly lots to see just in that area.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: CH-KO
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in wonderful Rome at this very nice hotel. Although it was not inside the historical cente, the Aventino hotel was very near and a 10-minute walk to the nearest metro station. We were a party of 4 young people (2 couples) and we all pretty much enjoyed the stay. It had a very romantic atmosphere, the rooms were beautiful and clean, not extremely spacious, but pretty much OK for a couple.The hotel staff were significantly helpful and polite and they satisfied all of our needs anytime of the day. We were very pleased. We actually booked a diner table at the near villa San Pio one night and we enjoyed a wonderful meal so we recommend that you do the same especially if you have had enough of the low quality of food on the restaurants near touristic spots. The only gray zone was the internet access. Eventhough the hotel offered free wi-fi or cable internet access you had to choose between those two otherwise if you tried the one you couldn't use the other, plus the access codes they gave us expired every 24 hours. Anyway if we went back to Rome we would choose to stay again in this hotel. We all had a fantastic experience.Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the premium price”
Reviews.Author: jamagory
Reviews.Content: The lack of welcome and assistance from the front desk staff at this hotel was its major fault. Forget getting advise or recommendations. They have free wi-fi but charge to use the public computer. The location is quiet and off the beaten path, yet not too far from the Metro, a 10 minute walk. Our room was lovely but tiny with a place to hang clothes but no drawers. Breakfast was the best thing; it was abundant and the servers were friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Old style elegance and charm in a villa on the Aventino Hill”
Reviews.Author: SeattleMarty
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Aventino is located in an upscale quiet neighborhood with fantastic views of Rome nearby . We really enjoyed our room with balcony, nearby trees, and chirping birds. The room wasn't "brand new", but comfortable and well kept, with graceful antique touches, high ceilings and marble floors in the bathroom. Very good breakfast. Good service from hotel staff. A bit of a walk to the metro station, but enjoyable area to walk around in. Loved peeking through the "Keyhole" on our way into the city center or coming back! Only negative was the older bathtub with jets which had a broken on/off button, causing confusion on how to stop the jets. Will definitely go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “peace and quiet within a stone's throw of central Rome”
Reviews.Author: brynsdad
Reviews.Content: We were recommended the Hotel Aventino by Irish friends who had stayed there twice and enthused about the location and classy charm of the hotel. They were right, it's a gem. The view of central Rome from the gardens of the monastery less than 5 minutes away is unforgettable and from there a cobbled street takes you down to the Tiber close to the historic Jewish Quarter and various Roman ruins. We travelled with my brother, sister-in-law and their teenage son and the three teenagers really appreciated being able to chill out kicking a ball in the street outside the hotel - it's more like being in a quiet market town than frenetic Rome. The only downside? - the lack of a bar, as it is a bit too far to walk down the hill (and more significantly back up again) for a nightcap. We did spend rather too much on taxis over the 3 days of our stay and the one from the airport was (literally) extortionate - be sure to ask the hotel to arrange your collection from Ciampino in advance, that way you will not be ripped off in true imperial Roman fashion. On our last evening we did walk back from a restaurant in Trastevere - not too far and a rare taste of non-touristy Rome. It's a wonderful city and when we return we will be booking the quiet, secluded Aventino again...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: AndrewandKurt
Reviews.Content: We were so glad to have been tipped off about the Aventino by some German friends of ours. The hotel is located atop one of the even hills of Rome in a very beautiful residential neighborhood filled with large nineteenth and twentieth century homes and several embassies. It is one of the most upscale areas of the city. The decor is lovely and our room although very small was graced with a large window, beautifully appointed with antique furniture, comfortable bed. We loved the hardwood floors and tiled bathroom. It overlooked a very nice garden. We had free internet in the rooms. The common areas were also beautiful and decorated in rich Roman 19th century style. Everything felt very clean and well attended to. Breakfast was great with plenty of fresh choices to choose from. Definitely more than I expected. Personally I was glad to be staying far from the maddening tourist crowd which is Rome. Staying here just requires some extra walking which we loved. In ten minutes you can reach Circus Maximus and in fifteen the Colosseum on foot. There are a number of decent restaurants, mainly informal places and also a supermarket just down the hill from the property. The reception help is a bit surly but professional and helpful. When booking this hotel they were very attentive to any email inquiries we had. And the best part of all, our lovely little room in this lovely end of town cost less than 100 euro per night! I am an expert travel bargain shopper with high standards and this place exceeded my expectations. My advice: don't get fleeced by overpriced Roman hotels near the station or Piazza Spana. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the barking dog!”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaCouple
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for tthe last two nights of a two week trip to Europe to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. All the other reviewers do a great job describing the location issue. You have to like to walk because the price you pay for staying in a lovely residential area is that you walk and you walk and you walk to get to either the subway or any interesting sites. The building is beautiful from the outside and our room (#343) was a little on the small side I'd say for Euro 220. Because we were in Rome in early October, the A/C had been turned off while we enjoyed two beautifully warm days. To get some air circulation in the room at night, we opened our french doors which unfortunately overlook a neighbor's home with a barking golden retriever. The dog starts barking around 5:45 or 6:00 a.m. and he was still barking at midnight when we tried to go to sleep. When we tried to take a nap during the day to make up for our lost sleep at night . . . guess what. Barking dog. I complained to the front desk and I wrote an email to the manager of the hotel after we returned asking for an adjustment to our bill. To no avail. There must be other rooms that don't face the barking dog house but be sure and ask. Our stay was nowhere near worth Euro 220/night. The lack of A/C coupled with the uncontrollable dog barking PLUS a management team that wasn't that interested in customer service was a HUGE negative.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in the past year.”
Reviews.Author: sailormanzizFlorence
Reviews.Content: I went on a one day trip with my husband in July and found the hotel to be well beyond my expectations. The room was cool late july with air conditioning and a lovely view on the breakfast garden. The furnishings were posh and rather on the baroque side, with antique furniture, parquet on the floor and a king size bed. The bathroom was very large with a jacuzzi and beautiful antique tiles. The room even had a refrigerator with drinks, internet connection, a safe and more than enough towelling. In other words it is a 3 star hotel but could very well be a 4 star one. It was just perfect. The breakfast was superb, with all kinds of marmellades, cakes, meats, fruits, cereal, etc. The hotel staff was extremely courteous and friendly and ready to help. Taxis were booked and arrived in less than 3 minutes. The Aventino hotel is smack in the middle of Rome, only a minutes taxi drive from Piazza Navona, Circo Massimo, Colosseo, etc. yet it is so silent , being tree-lined and on top of one of the poshest hills of Rome (the villa of the US Ambassador to the Papal State is only down hill from the hotel), that you don't feel you're in central Rome at all but in an exclusive residence. And all of this for only 90 euros per night. Every once in a while you get more than you ask for in life. I certainly will be back with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, nice hotel, a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: gnjley
Reviews.Content: Based on positive reviews here on TripAdvisor, my wife and I chose the Hotel Aventino for our 4 night stay in Rome. It really is a lovely little hotel located in what seems to be a nice Roman neighborhood. We really enjoyed waking up each morning to the peace and quiet of Aventino and the perfume of the flowers there in the air. Rome is such a busy/crowded city that you really appreciate staying in a place like this to get re-invigorated for the next day. Our room was better than we expected and came with in-room safe and all of the other amenties that one would expect in this price range. The TV was tiny, but we didn't travel all of the way to Rome to watch TV. It was unseasonably hot (in the 90s) in Rome during our stay, so the air conditioner came on every time we returned to our room. (The electricity to your room is turned off unless your card key is in the entry socket, so the room was always warm upon return but cooled within an hour.) Air conditioning would not have been on option in the heat & humidity during our stay, and we had heard horror stories on TripAdvisor about other properties who skimp on a/c. The Hotel Aventino staff was courteous and responsive. My wife's lost luggage arrived (finally ... after 9 days of the airline's incompetence!) and the concierge made sure that it got to us as soon as we got to our room. They also arranged transportation for us to get to FCO for our departing flight. (Note: You can easily take the Metro B line to Termini and take the Leonardo da Vinci Express to FCO; but the Metro B is packed to the gills during rush hour so don't expect an easy time boarding the train with your luggage in tow.) While there were positives about the neighborhood, it might not be for all travelers out there. You will do significantly more walking around the Roman sights than you would if you stayed in Piazza Navona, Campo di Fiore, or the Spanish Steps. Also, the Metro B line trains were not as nice as the Metro A trains; so my wife and I opted to walk versus ride the Metro to the Colosseum and Roman Forum. Suffice to say, we were completely worn out from all of the walking each night when we returned to Hotel Aventino. Hotel Aventino was cheaper than Piazza Navona or Campo di Fiore hotels, but we think that we'd opt for Campo di Fiore if we could the next time. With all that said, we'd still happily recommend this hotel to any friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: wahoo02
Reviews.Content: 10 minute walk to Circus Maximus metro or Pyramide. Quiet neighborhood. Awesome buffet breakfast - had a choice of pastries, cold cuts, boiled eggs, fresh fruit, yogurt, various cereals, jams, and pie/cake of the day. Room a bit small, but very clean and very well appointed and great service. Enjoyed our stay over all.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, only downside is price”
Reviews.Author: Platinum
Reviews.Content: Agree with most of the other reviews, nice location (although a bit of a treck from the nearest metro), rooms very nicely decorated and clean. Only real downsides were that the breakfasts were not great (most things had already gone if you rise late like us) and the rates are pretty expensive. But I would say it is still reasonable value. It's nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of downtown Rome at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it from the first minute”
Reviews.Author: ladisLT
Reviews.Content: I have seen on the website pretty nice reviews about this hotel, but in fact it was even better that I expected. We have booked two rooms: one double and one tiple as we came with our family: me, wife, daughter (12) and mother with her friend. For me it would be hard to differentiate all the areas, because the locations was perfect, rooms - big, reception - attentive. Maybe breakfast was't very rich, but anyway we are more focused on the quality of rooms and service, than breakfast as breakfast you can get in any other restaurant in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Peace in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sumr51
Reviews.Content: The BEST thing about this hotel is how quiet the area is...& YES, it's in Rome! Our room was small and cute & clean & we had a comfy bed & a bath with a shower. We drank Chianti in the garden & it was so relaxing! We walked to the Colloseum in about 15 minutes (I think we went the wrong way at first!) I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “a little gem”
Reviews.Author: lastofthesummerwine
Reviews.Content: sometimes in life you get a little bit more than you expected and our stay at the aventino is a prime example, this hotel is a little gem with a clean bright room a full size bathroom and a balcony that we requested (and if only we could have requested the weather to go with it ).if you are going to Rome this is the place to stay at a very reasonable price definitely excellent value helpful staff and a cracking breakfast to set you off on a days exploring

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING ROOM / BREAKFAST / SERVICE / GROUNDS!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoExpat
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, with wonderful amenities! Located on a quiet residential street, between TWO Metro stops, Circo Massimo & Pyramide. It's a 10 minute or less walk to the "club district," too! I had a HUGE marble roman jacuzzi tub, with windows that opened wide & out, above. There was a wall-height heated towel rack, and marble floors! The bed was GIGANTIC... King PLUS, If I had to guess! Nice wood flooring, and PLENTY of built-in drawers & an old-fashioned key wardrobe, built-in. Plenty of lighting, whatever the mood. Th tv was quite smallish, but a couple of music stations kept me entertained. Wet-bar (Pricey, as usual, so beware!) & a roomy desk to write your postcards at. There was also a bidet, and a room safe. Lighting fixtures pretty contemporary. The breakfast room buffet was delightful, and was included in the price, on Venere. Dining in, or out, in a glass-enclosed breakfast room, overlooking the gardens. The big, marble lobby was bright, pleasant & professional. They lock access to the garden area & hotel & night, for security, but desk always recognized me, on my return. NICE, new glass/chrome lift, too! The photos attached REALLY don't do it justice!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, peaceful hotel in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: gaylew1987
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on a trip to Rome last March for my birthday. We managed to get a great deal on the flights so thought we would splash out a little on a hotel rather than going for a cheap one in a noisy location. Aventino was perfect, not too pricey and in a lovely quiet residential area which is just what you need when you come back from a busy day sightseeing. We got what I think must be the best room in the hotel, right on the top of the building. We had the whole roof terrace to ourselves and it was really very private and secluded. The only thing to be careful of is the thunder! Because we were right on the top of the building, one night when there was a storm, the thunder was the loudest thing I have ever heard. The room quite literally shook and I actually thought we had either been bombed (!) or a plane had just crashed in the street! The bathrooms were lovely, good showers with lots of extra little jets shooting from everywhere. My parents stayed at the same hotel so we got to see their room, they had a jacuzzi bath tub in their bathroom which I would have loved! Breakfast was ok, nothing too special but just the usual continental breakfast. Nice if you're a fan of that but it got a bit boring for me. Luckily there were some gorgeous restaurants nearby to get dinner. Really cheap and the pizzas were amazing. Oh on my birthday at the hotel, they brought us a bottle of champagne and some chocolates up to the room on a little tray which was very sweet of them. It's pretty easy to catch a bus into the heart of Rome too, just a short walk to the bus stop and from there you can get pretty much anywhere you need to go. I think we managed to see most of the main attractions in the week that we were there. Finally, there is a lovely little tabby cat who lives at the hotel and she is sooo friendly. We often took her some ham from breakfast to feed her and she seemed to really appreciate it. Give her a cuddle from me if you stay at this hotel - which I recommend you do as it is beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: GoDominican
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Rome on our honeymoon, and we wanted a hotel that was quiet but still near the city center. The Aventine Hill, one of the fabled seven hills of Rome but entirely absent from some guidebooks (such as Rick Steves), is a great choice because it's the quietest area in central Rome. The Aventino Hotel is set in a largely residential area, very near Santa Sabina church and about a 15-20 minute walk from the ancient heart of Rome (the Circus Maximus, Forum Romanum, etc.), further from the Baroque center and the Vatican. If you want a hotel right in the middle of the action, this probably isn't the best choice; it's very peaceful and a short stroll from several ancient churches off the beaten path, but the trade-off is that it's not directly on a bus or Metro line (though there are several bus routes and the Circus Maximus Metro only a 10-15 minute walk away). Still, considering how chaotic Rome is, a quiet refuge at the end of a long day of sightseeing is worth a lot! The Aventino Hotel is the bottom-rated property (but still 3 stars) of 4 or 5 properties on the Aventine Hill, all run by the same owner. We were there during the off season, so our room cost half what it would during the summer and was a pretty good deal all around. The other guests we saw were mostly German-speaking, with a few Italians and Spanish as well. We had a vastly overpriced dinner at a nearby 4-star hotel run by the same owner and we noticed that all the other guests at that hotel were English-speaking (mostly Americans). We loved the little breakfast room at the Aventino and enjoyed the delicious spread each morning, but they do not have American-style offerings. The hotel is very clean and run by an excellent staff. My wife got the flu while we were in Rome, and the staff went out of their way to help us regardless of the time of day or night; the night porter even stood outside in the cold with me at 2:00 AM to tell a taxi driver where to take me to find an all-night pharmacy. Not all of the staff spoke English, but we managed to communicate nonetheless and found most of them to be very nice. Ours was a standard double room, simply furnished and quite small but with a nice bathroom. The bed took up most of the space in the main room. Because it was winter and rained a lot while we were there, the room was often quite damp, and this was not good for my wife's flu but couldn't be avoided; the room didn't seem to be very well-insulated, but it did have heat and air available on a wall thermostat. We splurged on this trip because it was our honeymoon, and if we were to go back to Rome we would probably stay somewhere cheaper. I wouldn't be able to bring myself to pay their summer rates, particularly since it's not located directly in the heart of the action, but overall we enjoyed our stay and can recommend the Aventino very warmly. Just don't get sick while you're in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Aventino”
Reviews.Author: cyfreithwr
Reviews.Content: A peaceful graceful hotel on the beautiful Aventine Hill.An easy walk to the restaraunts in Testaccio..a little further to Trastevere.Woke every morning to birds singing in the hotel garden.Breakfast varied and delicious...staff helpful.Thoroughly recomended and reasonably priced. Restaurants we paricularly enjoyed were Pizzeria Bean and in the same street..(Via Luca della Robbia in Testaccio) the absolutely wonderful Tuttifrutti

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful stay away from the crowds...”
Reviews.Author: shawnus
Reviews.Content: At this hotel you feel like you live in Rome. It's location on the Aventine is mostly residential and while there are no nearby restaurants or shops without a lengthy walk I felt it was a good trade-off. You can find a wide selection of shops and restaurants to the southwest - down the hill to Via Marmorata. There is a restaurant next door at the Hotel Villa S. Pio, but it is pricey and the food was so-so. Its ambience however was spectacular. There was a lush entrance garden, solarium-enclosed dining room and wine cellar-styled bar. The Aventino's amenities were above average and the service was efficient. Breakfast included a decent spread of pastries, fruit, juices and cold cuts. My room had a wrap around balcony with a superb view and two sets of ceiling to floor shuttered doors. (There is only one balcony room on each floor so make your request early!) Sleeping was a dream with no noise and the CH/A worked very well. See my pics for a better description of the room. There are a few sights right around the corner from the hotel worth mentioning. I found one of the best panoramic views of Rome from the citrus grove churchyard of Santa Sabina. Also in the neighborhood are the pyramid of Caius Cestius and a very pretty, yet very useful pedestrian-only road leading to the Tiber. It's a great shortcut down the hill. Find it past Santa Sabina to the North off of Via S. Sabina. The most exciting walk for me was a relatively short walk to the Northeast down the hill. Right before your eyes is the Circus Maximus, Palatine and a little bit further the Forum and Colosseum. I had a wonderful stay here. It was nice to come back to a quiet area and get some peace after a long day of walking, dodging traffic and being around other tourists. If you want the hub-bub this is not this place for you, but if you're looking for a tranquil, graceful escape to pretend you're not a tourist then this is sanctuary.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem!”
Reviews.Author: ladyrenoir
Reviews.Content: We thought this was was a wonderful place to stay! The room was lovely and immaculate, the bathroom was beautiful, we had a window that opened out onto the courtyard . . . the neighborhood is quiet so we slept with the window open. You will not be disappointed, the pictures are accurate on this website. There is a park across the street with the most spectacular view of Rome!!! The hotel is a 10-15 minute walk to Trastevere, which we loved and spent lots of time in. The location of the hotel was fine for us, we walked just about everywhere, enjoying the sights and daily "life" of the locals along the way. There are taxis everywhere if you want one, costing 6-10 euro to get just about anywhere. There are also buses one can catch just down the hill (10 minute walk). We loved being out of the hustle and bustle of Rome in this beautiful, quaint little neighborhood. The breakfast was more than adequate - pastries, breads, rolls, meats, cheeses, fruit, juices, cereals, tea and great capuccino. The restaurant at the San Anselmo (sister hotel) was the best dinner we had in Rome, we recommend it! You will be greeted with complimentary champagne and bruschetta, followed by an amazing meal in a small, intimate atmoshpere. The restaurant is just around the corner. We also had some great meals in Trastevere. Look around for restaurants filled with locals and you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “A bit out of the way for pot first stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Stine
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 5 days vacation in Rome, and we had booked the Avetino couse of the great deal on 114 euro pr nigth, the cheapest of all the 4 AVENTINO S. ANSELMO HOTELS. The surrondings was perfect, the hotel is on the Aventino Hills wich is a quiet neighbourhood with lots of green trees, but a bit out of the city for our taste. We ended up getting a cab in to the city when we were going out for dinner at nigth, we didnt bother to walk 10-15 min to the Metro, then change train too end up in the historic center. But in the other hand its truly was great to get out of al the hussel and traffic wich is al over the city. so if you want cam sorrundings and dont mind walking a bit, this is the hotel for you!! The room (#338) we got had a balcony and a jacuzzi, wich we had aksed for beforhand. Very stylich and comfortable, great to relax in after a day with stroling the city. We eat the hotel breakfast 2 times, it was ok with lots of sweets, rolls, cheese, meat, fruit and a great capuccino! The service was as good as you expect in this fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: nettie1
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our 4-night stay in the Aventino S. Anselmo and particularly appreciated the peace and quiet of its lovely residential location. Our room was a good size with a very comfortable bed, good quality bed linen and a great bathroom with spa bath. The breakfast was very pleasant, particularly by Italian standards as breakfasts are not usually that important in Italy. Having said that, the orange juice was an unusually artificial concoction - bright orange or bright red. And the lacy paper doily under the breakfast plate was a bit of a misstep in such stylish surroundings, but perhaps I was missing the irony! The hotel is a little bit out of the way - surely one of its main attractions - but the Via Marmorata (5 minutes walk down the hill) has plenty of buses, the routes 176, 23 and 75 stop here. The routes 175 and 715 take you part of the way up the Aventine hill. Piramide is the closest Metro stop. The streets behind the Via Marmorata have some very nice restaurants if you don't feel like going back into town. We particularly recommend the trattoria Bucatino and the pizzeria Bean, both offer fabulous meals at very good prices. Both restaurants had many local customers, which is always a good sign.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but disappointing location of room”
Reviews.Author: Mattgirl
Reviews.Content: First of all I want to say that this is a lovely hotel in the best section of Rome. Quiet and peaceful, yet close to the sights. We couldn't have asked for a better location (although because it is in a residential neighborhood it was difficult to find a restaurant on our first night in Rome when we did not wish to travel far for dinner). Just something to be aware of if you do not wish to head out into the chaos of the main city right away. Breakfast was great, and the staff were friendly and met all needs. The room was nice, very elegantly decorated. The disappointment was that the room was located not in the main building but in a little area next to the main street. There are only two rooms in this area. Our door opened right outside, like a motel rather than a hotel. The windows were barred and shuttered and we could only open a little window on our door to let in some sunlight. It felt too closed in and not a place where we could relax after long days of touring. I wasn't expecting a grand view, but it would have been nice to have something. Also being that this was Rome, I at first felt uncomfortable that we were not in a safe location for our items since we were not in the main building. The fear was calmed once I realized what a safe quiet neighborhood we were in. To be fair, I did not complain to the front desk about this or ask to be moved as I did not want to create a fuss. I'm sure that they would've moved us if there was room elsewhere if I had brought it up. I will definitely stay at this hotel again. It is a lovely hotel in a lovely area. However, I will specifically ask to stay in the main building and would recommend that others do the same. I was not aware that there were any rooms not in the main building until we were shown to ours. Just something that others should be aware of.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the maddening crowds”
Reviews.Author: tmd9015
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Aventino is a charming villa in the quiet, residential, Aventine Hills. It's the smallest of the Aventino S. Anselmo Hotels, which are right around the corner. Our room was the "attic room" and you actually had to ride the elevator or walk to the third floor and then go outside to a private courtyard and up a little flight of stairs to the room. We really enjoyed the quiet and privacy of this suite. The only thing that was a bit of a nuisance was that the key card had to be inserted to turn on any lights in the room. (This didn't allow you to leave any lights on for the evening.) The room was beautiful, and very clean, with white crisp sheets changed every day on the king-sized bed. The up-to-date bathroom had a large, vertical spa shower with adjustable jets. A typical Italian buffet breakfast with meats, cheese, luscious fresh fruit and warm cornetto was included in the room rate and you can enjoy it on the terrace. The one desk clerk can be a bit un-friendly, but if you do ask questions, he will answer them in a helpful manner. There is a nice restaurant in one of their larger hotels around the corner, Villa S. Pio, and he can make the reservation for you. We specifically chose this hotel to be away from the city and there are a few sites to see in the area,(the keyhole with a view to St. Peter's at the Piazza dei Cavalieri di Malta was a favorite and the Colosseum are close by) but you should be prepared to either walk or take a taxi to get into town. I recommend this lovely little villa to anyone who would like to experience Rome by day and experience peace at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scooner
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Aventino on a trip to Rome in March. We needed two more nights lodging rather late in our planning, and found space here. At first we thought it was a long way from everything we wanted to see, but it really isn't bad. It is quite close to the Baths of Caracalla, the Servian Walls, the Circus Maximus and the hill that had the emperors' palaces. This hotel was very clean, very nice staff, nice room, good breakfast. Very quiet. We had a window that looked out over a courtyard, really pretty view. The room was small but that is to be expected I think. The bed was big enough and we slept great. They even had computer that hooked up through the TV that we could check our email on and get notes from Grandma who was keeping the kids! Finally, they left complementary champagne in our room on my husband's birthday, which we though was very nice. We really enjoyed staying here and after seeing our other hotels in Rome we wished we had stayed here the whole time! It is not quite as central as the next hotel we stayed in, but that hotel had other drawbacks. Thanks for a very very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: PMwhf
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews below!! This place is so quiet and relaxing. The gardens and rooms are superb, as is the breakfast. Staff are v helpful, umbrellas provided for those Roman summer thunderstorms This hotel is part a group of 3 on the Aventine Hill - the San Pio and Sant Anslemo being the others. have stayed at all three - the Sant Anselmo is pricey and to be honest the only benefit it has over this place is slighlty more decorative and larger rooms. The San Pio is worth a look, especially if you can book in their low season. If you want quality without paying top price then this place is the one.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been more lovely ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, wonderful breakfast, lovely room, great staff. We could not ask for anything better. --- Well, ice may have been nice! That is a small thing to give up for all the other amenities.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Aventino
HotelInfo.Address: Via San Domenico 10, 00153 Rome, Italy
